meanings.definition: To release from a lease or rental agreement.
meanings.sent1: The landlord unleased the apartment after the tenant moved out.
meanings.sent2: She unleased the car when she realized she no longer needed it.
meanings.sent3: The magician unleased the rabbit from the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The storm unleased its fury on the small town, causing widespread damage.
meanings.sent5: The chef unleased a burst of flavors in the dish, delighting the diners.

meanings.sent1: The unleased property remained vacant for months.
meanings.sent2: They decided to purchase the unleased land for future development.
meanings.sent3: The unleased room in the hotel was rumored to be haunted.
meanings.sent4: The unleased storefront stood out among the bustling shops on the street.
meanings.sent5: The unleased equipment gathered dust in the storage room.
